dt: {bc}a grammatical construction in which two usually adjacent nouns having the same referent stand in the same syntactical relation to the rest of a sentence (such as {it}the poet{/it} and {it}Burns{/it} in "a biography of the poet Burns")
{bc}the relation of one of such a pair of nouns or noun equivalents to the other
{bc}the deposition of successive layers upon those already present (as in cell walls)

shortdef: a grammatical construction in which two usually adjacent nouns having the same referent stand in the same syntactical relation to the rest of a sentence (such as the poet and Burns in "a biography of the poet Burns")
the relation of one of such a pair of nouns or noun equivalents to the other
an act or instance of apposing; specifically : the deposition of successive layers upon those already present (as in cell walls)
